intro: Microhystrix sibirica, commonly known as the Siberian microhystrix, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the cold climates of Siberia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subarctic regions. Due to its limited distribution and sensitivity to environmental changes, it is considered a species of conservation concern. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and botanical research.
